title: How to Color Your Nails With Sharpie Markers

steps.title: Decide what color Sharpie you want on your nails.
steps.content: Decide what color Sharpie you want on your nails.

steps.title: Wash your hands in warm water and gently push your cuticles back.
steps.content: Wash your hands in warm water and gently push your cuticles back. Remove your other polish if you have any. Then trim, cut or file your nails as needed.

steps.title: Paint all of your nails with a base coat.
steps.content: Paint all of your nails with a base coat. This will protect your natural nails from staining (although the Sharpie will come off) and help you remove the design easier with nail polish remover

steps.title: Start coloring your non-dominant hand with your dominant one.
steps.content: Start coloring your non-dominant hand with your dominant one. If you are right handed, color your left, and vice versa. When you're finished, ask someone to do your other hand for you.

steps.title: Coat your nails with a top coat afterwards.
steps.content: Coat your nails with a top coat afterwards. It'll be a lot shinier than if you just leave it, and it will last longer. This is optional.

steps.title: To remove the Sharpie, simply wipe your nails with nail polish remover to take off the color.
steps.content: To remove the Sharpie, simply wipe your nails with nail polish remover to take off the color.

steps.title: Trim your nails and file them!
steps.content: Trim your nails and file them! Your nails should be neatly trimmed and filed.

steps.title: Look for regular nontoxic markers.
steps.content: Look for regular nontoxic markers. Try using crayola markers, they do make good fake nail polish! Try to have them be washable, in case you don't want it and want to wash it off. Also, although the fat markers make it messier to paint nails, use them because they won't run out of ink as quickly as thinner ones. Watercolor paints work well too, as they wash off better.

steps.title: Pick your favorite color.
steps.content: Pick your favorite color. You should wear something that matches. If you are wearing a purple dress or shirt, put on purple! Always make sure that it matches -- otherwise you'll look really odd (and your parents will find out!).

steps.title: Lay your fingers down on a hard surface (such as a table), splayed.
steps.content: Lay your fingers down on a hard surface (such as a table), splayed.

steps.title: Take your marker or brush and paint away on your nails.
steps.content: Take your marker or brush and paint away on your nails. Don't mind about messing up -- the ink can be removed.

steps.title: Wait for the color to dry.
steps.content: Wait for the color to dry. Eat a snack, clean up your supplies, or just do something that lasts a minute.

steps.title: Look at your nails.
steps.content: Look at your nails. They should be dry, but look for parts of the nail without as much color as others. Take your marker and repaint the lighter areas of the nail. The color across the nail should be consistently strong.

steps.title: Get a cotton swab and wet it with hot water.
steps.content: Get a cotton swab and wet it with hot water. Gently brush around the nail and remove all the marker that is not on the nail.

steps.title: Finished!
steps.content: Finished! Enjoy your "fake nail polished" nails!
